items.content_html: For years I paid for Spotify. With Apple One it didn’t make sense to pay for 2 music services so I dropped Spotify. With Spotify I discovered new music all the time. After 2+ years of being an Apple Music customer I have finally discovered my first new song. Way to go Apple!
items.content_text: For years I paid for Spotify. With Apple One it didn't make sense to pay for 2 music services so I dropped Spotify. With Spotify I discovered new music all the time. After 2+ years of being an Apple Music customer I have finally discovered my first new song. Way to go Apple!

items.content_html: Every year I buy the new iPhone since the camera keep getting better and that is my primary use really. However, I often wonder why I lug around my heavy camera gear when the iPhone is not too shabby. This was taken with the iPhone 13 Pro from a moving train.

items.content_html: Per my previous Yeti post‚Ä¶not once during the process was I asked when I purchased the cooler. It was 7+ years old.
items.content_text: Per my previous Yeti post‚Ä¶not once during the process was I asked when I purchased the cooler. It was 7+ years old.

items.content_html: I know people bash on Yeti and their prices, but I just placed a warranty claim (zipper broke) for the first time (and I have a ton of yeti gear) and they responded within 30 minutes on a Saturday asking which color cooler I wanted them to send me. That‚Äôs worth the price to me.
items.content_text: I know people bash on Yeti and their prices, but I just placed a warranty claim (zipper broke) for the first time (and I have a ton of yeti gear) and they responded within 30 minutes on a Saturday asking which color cooler I wanted them to send me. That‚Äôs worth the price to me.

items.content_html: I love fracture prints. I have many hanging up in our house. Until this sunset shot though they were all from my Canon 5D Mark IV or DJI Mavic 2 Pro. The sunset shot was taken with an iPhone XS back in July 2019, but looks beautiful in a 22‚Äùx29‚Äù print. So surprised.
items.content_text: I love [fracture](https://fractureme.com) prints. I have many hanging up in our house. Until this sunset shot though they were all from my Canon 5D Mark IV or DJI Mavic 2 Pro. The sunset shot was taken with an iPhone XS back in July 2019, but looks beautiful in a 22‚Äùx29‚Äù print. So surprised.

items.title: Vimeo Disappoints
items.content_html:
I am so disappointed with Vimeo right now. I have spent two weeks with their support crew attempting to get a CSV file with my 147 videos with download links. They keep sending me a file with only 47. And since I started the ticket my paid account has expired so I can‚Äôt see all my videos.

I started paying for Vimeo 12 years ago because I wanted to support a superior product. Since then YouTube has improved their system so video quality is the same on both platforms. I continued to support Vimeo because I just didn‚Äôt want to give in to the Google machine. However, now I‚Äôm second guessing myself. I‚Äôm assuming I‚Äôd have no issues retrieving my original videos for 12 years from YouTube, but have yet to do so with Vimeo.
items.content_text:
I am so disappointed with Vimeo right now. I have spent two weeks with their support crew attempting to get a CSV file with my 147 videos with download links. They keep sending me a file with only 47. And since I started the ticket my paid account has expired so I can‚Äôt see all my videos. 

I started paying for Vimeo 12 years ago because I wanted to support a superior product. Since then YouTube has improved their system so video quality is the same on both platforms. I continued to support Vimeo because I just didn‚Äôt want to give in to the Google machine. However, now I‚Äôm second guessing myself. I‚Äôm assuming I‚Äôd have no issues retrieving my original videos for 12 years from YouTube, but have yet to do so with Vimeo.

items.title: Day One
items.content_html: I have been using Day One, a journaling app, for years. I‚Äôm not an avid user. I‚Äôm lucky to average two entries a week. However, I do try to capture places we go and family events that are out of the ordinary. The biggest motivator to do this is the printed book I buy at the end of the year. It is well-made and a pleasure to thumb through from time to time. If you use tags right, you can even make a ‚Äúpublic‚Äù book easily if you wish to give them as gifts to family members.
items.content_text: I have been using Day One, a journaling app, for years. I‚Äôm not an avid user. I‚Äôm lucky to average two entries a week. However, I do try to capture places we go and family events that are out of the ordinary. The biggest motivator to do this is the printed book I buy at the end of the year. It is well-made and a pleasure to thumb through from time to time. If you use tags right, you can even make a ‚Äúpublic‚Äù book easily if you wish to give them as gifts to family members.

items.content_html:
If the Latest Facebook Revelations Won’t Get You to Delete It, What Will?

Facebook’s practices are the online equivalent of a home invasion: Zuckerberg rooting around in your underwear drawer for the good stuff.

So close to deleting my account for good.
items.content_text:
[If the Latest Facebook Revelations Won't Get You to Delete It, What Will?](https://www.esquire.com/lifestyle/amp25645143/facebook-privacy/)

> Facebook's practices are the online equivalent of a home invasion: Zuckerberg rooting around in your underwear drawer for the good stuff.

So close to deleting my account for good.

items.title: Costa Rica
items.content_html: I just returned from a six day trip to Costa Rica. Unfortunately it was for work so I did not have much free time. However, I did manage to set aside some time for photography. items.content_text:
![Delicious Breakfast in Costa Rica](/uploads/2005/09/0620422427_200509_20D_10939.jpg)

I just returned from a six day trip to Costa Rica. Unfortunately it was for work so I did not have much free time. However, I did manage to set aside some time for photography. In the next week I will work on posting a gallery…though I should work on an Alaska gallery considering that trip was months ago. I did post several photos from Costa Rica on my photo blog though: [http://blog.digitalbohling.com](http://blog.digitalbohling.com/), so make sure you visit that site. In the meantime, I did create a Costa Rica wallpaper (updated 2011.02.27 - cannot find wallpaper) if you are interested.
